segment.source: How to Use Quick Search
segment.target: How to Use Quick Search

segment.source: How to Use Quick Search
segment.target: How to Use Quick Search

segment.source: How to Use Quick Search
segment.target: How to Use Quick Search

segment.source: In Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA), you can perform a quick search across all the rows in data tables.
segment.target: In Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA), you can perform a quick search across all the rows in data tables.

segment.source: This differs from a regular data search (Search or Filter Data) in that you do not have to specify search parameters such as a query, process (for example, equal, not equal to, or contains) or filters such as match case, search up, etc.
segment.target: This differs from a regular data search (Search or Filter Data) in that you do not have to specify search parameters such as a query, process (for example, equal, not equal to, or contains) or filters such as match case, search up, etc.

segment.source: Note You can, however, add a query to fine tune your quick search.
segment.target: Note You can, however, add a query to fine tune your quick search.

segment.source: To use Quick Search
segment.target: To use Quick Search

segment.source: Click the magnifying glass icon on the title bar of the graph.
segment.target: Click the magnifying glass icon on the title bar of the graph.

segment.source: A popup menu opens.
segment.target: A popup menu opens.

segment.source: Enter the desired text.
segment.target: Enter the desired text.

segment.source: When you enter partial text (for example, entering CO for COM Call) WPA will filter the data in all rows using that string.
segment.target: When you enter partial text (for example, entering CO for COM Call) WPA will filter the data in all rows using that string.

segment.source: If the text doesn't match any of the data in the rows, the field becomes red (even before you click ) when the text is entered.
segment.target: If the text doesn't match any of the data in the rows, the field becomes red (even before you click ) when the text is entered.

segment.source: To find and highlight all instances of the text you entered, click Find All.
segment.target: To find and highlight all instances of the text you entered, click Find All.

segment.source: WPA highlights all the rows (in the table) that contain the text you entered.
segment.target: WPA highlights all the rows (in the table) that contain the text you entered.

segment.source: If a row does not contain the text you entered, it is not highlighted but remains in its table row; this is important as it differs from how WPA returns search results when you use Filter To as described in Step 4.
segment.target: If a row does not contain the text you entered, it is not highlighted but remains in its table row; this is important as it differs from how WPA returns search results when you use Filter To as described in Step 4.

segment.source: To return only the instances that contain the text you entered, click Filter To.
segment.target: To return only the instances that contain the text you entered, click Filter To.

segment.source: WPA then only displays the rows that contain the text you entered and removes all rows whose data does not contain the text you entered.
segment.target: WPA then only displays the rows that contain the text you entered and removes all rows whose data does not contain the text you entered.

segment.source: WPA only displays the rows that contain the text you entered and removes all the rows that do not contain the text you entered.
segment.target: WPA only displays the rows that contain the text you entered and removes all the rows that do not contain the text you entered.

segment.source: To add a query and/or filter to your quick search, click ... and then click to display a dropdown of queries you can add.
segment.target: To add a query and/or filter to your quick search, click ... and then click to display a dropdown of queries you can add.

segment.source: To add a Delay Type, click the contains dropdown, select the criteria you want to use (for example, equals, contains, etc.), and then enter the search string you want to use.
segment.target: To add a Delay Type, click the contains dropdown, select the criteria you want to use (for example, equals, contains, etc.), and then enter the search string you want to use.

segment.source: Tip To remove the Delay Type, click the X in the row that contains the Delay Type (as you can have more than one) you want to delete.
segment.target: Tip To remove the Delay Type, click the X in the row that contains the Delay Type (as you can have more than one) you want to delete.

segment.source: By default, the Query includes Delay Type contains, which you can also delete.
segment.target: By default, the Query includes Delay Type contains, which you can also delete.

segment.source: To fine tune your query, select one of the options, such as Match Case or Search collapsed rows).
segment.target: To fine tune your query, select one of the options, such as Match Case or Search collapsed rows).

segment.source: Click Find All to find all data rows that meet your search criteria.
segment.target: Click Find All to find all data rows that meet your search criteria.

segment.source: Click Find Next to find the next data row that meets your search criteria.
segment.target: Click Find Next to find the next data row that meets your search criteria.

segment.source: Click Cancel to not include the query in your quick search.
segment.target: Click Cancel to not include the query in your quick search.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Search or Filter Data
